metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11187 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Incorrect Access Control in the LDAP class of GONICUS GOsa through 2019-04-11 allows an attacker to log into any account with a username containing the case-insensitive substring "success" when an arbitrary password is provided.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11187` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gosa - 2.7.4+reloaded2-9ubuntu1.1
gosa-desktop - 2.7.4+reloaded2-9ubuntu1.1
gosa-help-de - 2.7.4+reloaded2-9ubuntu1.1

criterions.comment: fusiondirectory: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
gosa package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.4+reloaded2-9ubuntu1.1').
